item.description: Mindful-tube is a minimalist web app for focused YouTube viewing, built with Next.js and TailwindCSS to eliminate distractions.

item.title: React JS introduction
Built-in React hooks
item.description: Built-in React hooks let you use different React features from your components

item.title: Core concepts to understand in React JS
item.description: Explore the essential building blocks of React JS, including components, state, props, and lifecycle methods. This guide is perfect for beginners looking to grasp the core concepts that power modern React applications.

item.title: in React JS state represents the internal data or condition of a component
item.description: in React JS state represents the internal data or condition of a component

item.title: React uses a virtual DOM to optimize updates to the actual DOM
in React JS components are reusable pieces of UI that can be defined as functions
item.description: in React JS components are reusable pieces of UI that can be defined as functions

item.title: react application architecture
Suspense is React feature that allows you to suspend rendering until certain conditions are met
item.description: Suspense is React feature that allows you to suspend rendering until certain conditions are met, such as data loading or code splitting

item.title: client side rendering vs server side rendering
item.description: the difference between client side and server side rendering is in what sources are being sent to the client and when the full rendering of the page happens

item.title: reconciliation is the process by which React determines what has changed in the virtual DOM and updates the actual DOM efficiently
in React JS props are used to pass data from a parent component to a child component
item.description: in React JS props are used to pass data from a parent component to a child component
